definition: to provoke/to stir up/to incite
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: He is one of those people who always seem intent on stirring up trouble among his workmates.
sentences.chinese: 他是個有意要在工友之間挑起糾紛的那種人。

sentences.english: Chinawill not wage an offensive war now.
sentences.chinese: 中國現在不會挑起一場進攻戰。

sentences.english: Dug activists even disrupted what was to be a placid, respectful funeral for the fallen Moe.
sentences.chinese: 達格族激進分子甚至在莫的肅穆葬禮上挑起騷亂。

sentences.english: The adulterated honey can not be chosen, or can't become silks to choose either.
sentences.chinese: 摻假蜂蜜則不能被挑起，也不能挑成絲狀。

sentences.english: The flame is just there, which only needs to be enkindled.
sentences.chinese: 火焰就在那裏，只是需要挑起。

sentences.english: They’re afraid to make waves, and therefore, they avoid changes.
sentences.chinese: 他們害怕挑起風波，所以他們避免做出改變。

sentences.english: Georgian and South Ossetian officials have accused each other of initiating the hostilities.
sentences.chinese: 格魯吉亞和南奧塞梯官員相互指責對方挑起敵對行動。

sentences.english: I made shoulder strong enough to carry the weight of the world. Yet, gentle enough to give comfort.
sentences.chinese: 我使她的肩膀能挑起整個世界的重擔，並且柔情似水。

sentences.english: I made her shoulders strong enough to carry the weight of the world; yet , gentle enough to give comfort.
sentences.chinese: 我使她的肩膀能挑起整個世界的重擔，並且柔情似水。

sentences.english: They were busy canvassing and drumming up sentiment against the new government.
sentences.chinese: 他們當時正忙於遊說，挑起對新政府的不滿情緒。

sentences.english: He shouldered the loaded carrying pole and walked off with a swing.
sentences.chinese: 他挑起擔子顫悠顫悠地走了。

sentences.english: We are really working hard to start a WWIII, don't we?….
sentences.chinese: 我們在努力挑起第三次世界大戰，是嗎？

sentences.english: provoked the situation and doubled its mistakes, causing further escalation.
sentences.chinese: 日方挑起事端，又錯上加錯，導致事態進一步升級。

sentences.english: So what exactly is it about the new ball that's provoking all the controversy?
sentences.chinese: 那麼究竟這個新的比賽用球是怎麼挑起這些爭論的呢？

sentences.english: One at a time, push each pin up with the paperclip.
sentences.chinese: 用回形針將鎖裏的針腳一個一個地挑起來。

definition: to entice/to arouse/to provoke
capital of Wei 魏 during Warring states/CL:根[gen1]
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
dispute/controversy/conflict
to incite disharmony/to instigate
to infuriate/to enrage/to exasperate
to arouse/to evoke/to cause/to stir up
to start a war/to make war/to battle against
to get involved in/to meddle/interference
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
ambition/wild schemes/careerism
to lift (a lid)/to rock/to convulse
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
internal disorder/civil strife/civil unrest
to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
to take on (a responsibility)
